website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser HD 600 headphones are a good choice for home listening if you're willing to pay for high-quality sound.
pros: Sennheiser's high-end open-air headphones deliver deep bass, luxuriously padded ear cups, and a replaceable cord for a more economical price than their flagship model
cons: not the best solution for portable listening
gray and black plastic finish doesn't scream high end

customer_reviews.title: HD 600 faces strong competition in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I own these, Grado SR325's and AKG K712's. All similarly priced open back headphones and all purchased through Amazon. I have tried all 3 with digital and analog sources and with old fashioned MOSFET amplification as well as modern Op-Amp amplification. Compared to the Grado and AKG counterparts, I do not prefer the sound of these. The most distinct area these are lacking is in the treble, which lacks the clarity of the AKG's or smoothness of the Grado's. They are however built sturdily and quite comfortable, especially compared to the Grados. Thus the "It's okay." 3 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: thatguy2042

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, Neutral, Magical
customer_reviews.text: After comparing the HD 600, 650, 660S for a week, I actually went with the HD600s. There was something magical about these, not to mention they are the best value of the bunch. The HD 650 were darker, and the HD 660S were brighter. The vocals were best on the HD 600s imo. The HD660S pushes the vocals back a tad to make room for some treble, if that makes sense. It sounded more balanced overall, but I found myself loving the HD 600 more on most tracks. It was a tough choice, but my ears and wallet are happy.
customer_reviews.author: slifox

customer_reviews.title: I am no longer buying expensive electronics from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Every time I purchase high end electronics from Amazon I get the feeling that my package, once it arrives, is the result of an openbox special. That is, it has been opened previously and pieces are missing. I never get everything that is supposed to show up.
customer_reviews.author: John Dubchak

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent and detailed sound stage.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these 600s a few years. No issues rock solid. They do have a snug fit and you will definitely know they are on your head. Wonderful sound stage, the sounds swirl and dance around your ears, truely awesome. These are the most expensive headphones I have ever purchased at 350 dollars. I was hesitant, as I buy vintange audio gear on the cheap, and can buy an entire sound system for 350 bucks, but these are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect (almost)
customer_reviews.text: They are heaven for your ears. Went from Hifiman HE 500s to these and what can I say. There are almost no trade offs with the HD 600. You get everything, great mids, highs and a good low end that is not sloppy in any way. They are extremely light which makes them very, very comfortable. Comfort is huge for me, as the HE 500s made my neck sore to the point where I didn't want to use them for fear of the pain coming back. I am using the HD 600 with a Schitt Jotunheim amp/dac and the combo has been excellent. The HD 600 will always be in my possession.
customer_reviews.author: equalspeace

customer_reviews.title: It's super comfortable and music just immerse you in
customer_reviews.text: This was my first high quality headphone set and I have no regret buying this. I've watched tons of videos before buying it so I did not buy it on impulse. I bought my self a Beyerdynamics 770 pro for everyday use but this HD600 is a treat after a hard day of work. I'm not a audiophile yet I was blown away. I do not regret one bit about buying this and I will use it for next 10-20years to come. It was worth every penny that I've worked hard for. It's super comfortable and music just immerse you in. It's something I've never experienced before on a headset before buying this.I love this HD-600.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: not a fan of the faux marble plastic, but the sound is pristine. find a good audiophile review of these particular headphones, if you need all of the intricacies spelled out for you. personally, i have a set of audio technica ath-m50x, sennheiser hd 280 pro, and vmoda crossfades as well, and these blow all of them out of the water. you'll need an amplifier to do them any justice. sure, you can hear sound out of them if you plug them into your phone or ipod or whatever, but the resistance on these headphones is significantly higher than on your standard run of the mill headphones. so, you'll need a bit more 'oomph' to push sound into these.
customer_reviews.author: your mother

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good. Sounds great with tube amps.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to ramble about audiophile things. Suffice it to say, I seem to keep coming back to these headphones. I have other styles of headphones in various different price tiers (Audio Technica mx50's, SendyAudio Aivas, etc...), and for some reason, I keep coming back to these. There is a little bit of sticker shock, but if you care about your listening experience, the price is well worth it. One word of advice: these headphones are a little hard to drive, so your cellphone probably won't power them to your liking. They definitely want to run on a headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: David Tookey

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones for MIxing
customer_reviews.text: You know how TTS = True To Size in the clothing world? Well.... it's TTS in the mixing world too... True To Sound. Everything I hear is accurate. Hands down the best for producers/mixing-mastering. Comfortable and spacious room for your ears; the padding makes it feel great. Not too light, not too heavy, it's juuuuuust right. It's in the goldilocks zone just like Earth. Feels sturdy, definitely not falling off your head while in-use. Again, these are accurate and [T]rue [T]o [S]ound
customer_reviews.author: Blank Bates

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic since 1996.
customer_reviews.text: This headphone really didn't get outdated. It is still worth every penny. The treble on the HD600 is the best I've ever heard regardless of price. The midrange timbre and tonality is absolutely second to none. A warm, non-fatiguing sound signature with absolute uncanny realism in the tonality that so many headphones just seem to miss.
customer_reviews.author: TheGamingOnion

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones. Definitely need a headphone amp to get the best sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones. I have always been a fan of Sennheiser. In my opinion this unit requires a headphone amp to really push the sound. The only complaint I have is the open back design. It lets in a lot of ambient sound. These headphones require a very quiet room to fully enjoy. You will also be sharing what you are listening to with others nearby as the headphone sounds bleed outside as well. If that is no problem for you, these Sennheisers are amazing. I tested these with a Fiio Mark II amp.
customer_reviews.author: PinkTwig

customer_reviews.title: Love These Headphones. Audiophile Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality of sound, study construction , and no need for an extension jack. The chord is long enough to sit in your favorable sofa/ chair a considerable distance from your amp or receiver. Be careful not to trip over or become tangled in the chord as its thin and can sustain damage if improperly tampered with. Like many headphones. When done for the evening, prefer to place mine in the headphone holder apparatus I own and gently wrap The chord around the base. The cups are large and fully cover the years. Yet I have used for lengthy periods of time and hasn't fatigued me. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Brodinsky

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Incredible midrange for voice or acoustic instruments that has to be heard to be appreciated. There is no better headphone for $299 which is what they were on Amazon when i purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these headphones after I broke them in
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these headphones after I broke them in. At first, they sounded a bit too muted for my taste. but then, I went ahead and got a better sound card with an AMP, and it was like nothing I've never heard before. Bands like Infected Mushroom, Crystal Method, and Skrillex sounded more realistic, while Metal bands like Nine Inch Nails sounded as if they were in the same room. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Charleen Brown

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Get them
customer_reviews.text: Came back after another month and am in love with these headphones. I have Bode, Sony XM3, Nuraphones, Beats,... These are a new level and I will never go back. AMAZING. - - - After the break-in period of 3 days or so, these sounded amazing. I love them. Now my Sony XM3s sound like crap. Moved to amazon HD hi res music to really add to the experience. Highly recommended. Love the refreshed, simple look. Update after a month: These are my go-to headphones. The sound quality makes me relegate my Bluetooth headphones to only mobile use. They are also crazy comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T.Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I my 50 years of buying audio equipment I have never received any audio product so cheaply packaged. I was shocked. The headphone itself? The wire is crappy and way too long, the corrections scream cheap. I am shocked by these. I read something about a cheap run of these now being in the market place, I clearly got something I did not expect from the old reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of cans, my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile, but these are amazing for the average consumer! I have had them for half a year now and I use them once/week with a headphone amplifier. They are very comfortable and i can wear them on hours at a time. I am a music junkie and i use these over all the pairs of headphones i have: audio technica ath m50s, grado st80i sennheiser hd598s. If you love your music and wish you could update your listening experience, these are one of the essential steps you should take. Buy these. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Nemesio C.

customer_reviews.title: Godly headphones when used with an appropiate amp
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely top notch - super neutral sounding, very very good detail & just overall brilliant. Had to re-listen to a bunch of old favorites and I could hear totally new things. Beware though, while they "work" with an iphone etc as a source, they aren't going to be better than the HD598 (to which I directly compared them). With an amp (I have an O2 that someone put together for me) it's night and day, they're absolutely worth the $100ish incremental price.
customer_reviews.author: AlexS

customer_reviews.title: MAKE SURE TO REPLACE THE CABLE WITH THE HD650 ORIGINAL CABLE. Bend the headband too, bighead.
customer_reviews.text: I love the HD600 instead of just liking them, finally after owning them for a year, because I replaced the original cable that comes with the small red and black plugs with the HD650 cable that is stronger and is an upgrade in sound quality. Also so they aren't so tight on your head bend the metal by only holding the metal. My big head thanks me. My HD558 are strong plastic and have always fit comfortably, but the HD600 might need bending for some people.
customer_reviews.author: BlackCat

customer_reviews.title: is the best I owned
customer_reviews.text: I can't praise this headphones enough. I own a HD 558, 598, Fidelio X2, Klipsch bluetooth headset, bose quiet comfort and a few others and HD600, by far, is the best I owned. It does not color your music which is a rare quality for high end headphones. I want my music as is. For changes, I have my equalizer. I use a mediocre DAC/ Headphone amp ( Creative ) and I'm pretty sure that I haven't yet unlocked the true potential of these headphones. Once you hear them, there is no going back.. so, beware ha ha.
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep

customer_reviews.title: The build of the HD600 is very good. It has a hard plastic surrounding around the ...
customer_reviews.text: The build of the HD600 is very good. It has a hard plastic surrounding around the ear cups, and the same hard plastic for the headband, with memory foam bumps on the part that touches your head, and metal hinges to adjust the height. The grills are metal, and the earpads are memory foam with velour covering them. When bought new, I hear that the clamp force is very strong, and the pads are stiff. Fortunate for me, I bought mine used, and the previous owner had already stretched the metal hinges so that they are very comfortable and practically float on my head. Overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: CY Liang

customer_reviews.title: Total impulse purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I wondered; "what's the fuss really all about?" I get it now. Two albums into my ownership of these cans and I get the hype. Very nice. I'm using the unassuming headphone out on an elderly NAD preamplifier and it sounds great. Really great. Clear and detailed. Enough bass for me and the treble and midrange are right where they should be. The OEM cable kind of sucks but it's at least supple and doesn't knot itself up. Happy with the purchase. I'm betting the sound improves over time but out of the box the sound is great. ***update*** Wow. Just wow.
customer_reviews.author: DavidGeeTop Contributor: Blues Music

customer_reviews.title: A little tight, but amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. Powerful, clear, great soundfield, amazing bass. I had to pull them off to make sure my sub wasn't actually on, the bass is so rich. The one negative for me is they are quite tight and can become a little painful after an hour or so, although they've loosened up a bit over time. Still not enough for me to knock anything off the score, though, these are just fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Boosman

customer_reviews.title: so i decided to indulge a little and get these headphones because I've heard great things about these headphones through the web
customer_reviews.text: WOW, these headphones are incredible. My Sony MDR-7056's were getting long in the tooth and really starting to fall apart, so i decided to indulge a little and get these headphones because I've heard great things about these headphones through the web and word of mouth. Sound Quality did not disappoint. The open back experience is phenomenal and really heightens your listening experience beyond anything a pair of traditional closed back headphones or ear buds can deliver. My only qualm with the headphones are the cables. I wish there was more flexibility and ability for adjustment, because the split between left and right happens too quickly. however, the overall experience relative to price cannot be matched. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JonathanK

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 stars at that price point.
customer_reviews.text: So, I've decided to check legendary HD600 at my home studio, just in case. Compared them with Oppo PM-3(yeah, closed, I know) and DT 990 Pro using DX3 Pro DAC. Sound is good, loud and clear, better isolation then DT 990 Pro, clearer than PM-3, but. But DT 990 sounds a just a tiny bit better for me and...they more than twice cheaper. End of story. Overall good headphones, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: FleinSopp

customer_reviews.title: They are Worthy of the Hype
customer_reviews.text: I am a headphone and iem's addict. I currently own 61 pair of headphones priced from $ 20.00 to $ 700.00. I will not go into a long winded review their are hundreds out there. I will say that these are probably the most balanced refined headphones I own without being dry sounding. They check all the boxes. They are one of my four favorite cans but probably the best pair for all around performance. I listen to other cans for their signature sound. If I could only own one pair at this price point it would be these.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the midrange
customer_reviews.text: Well known headphones I have them paired to a magi/modi and these headphones really are great. When you first put them on they feel a bit tight (clamping force) but after adjusting the headband a bit and wearing them for about half an hour they settle in and are actually quite comfortable. I mainly listen to vocals and this headsets sound stage is perfect for it. Bass isn't emphasized here like it is with a lot of other headphones so vocals come out clear rather than being drowned out by the bass. On the other hand these headphones won't give you that boom that comes with bass centered headphones.
customer_reviews.author: tenrow

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: For $300 can't be beat. This is the point of diminishing returns for headphones. You can spend a lot more and get more detail (or too much) but not necessarily more musicality. With the aftermarket Cardas wiring set, I prefer these to much higher-priced 'phones for their neutrality and lack of harshness in the high-mids. As many have written about the HD600, you may need a good headphone amp to enjoy these.
customer_reviews.author: bassturd146

customer_reviews.title: Loved This Headphone for Vocals and VOIP
customer_reviews.text: Talking to people on this headphone was the most enjoyable out of any headphone I've used. Music revolving vocals for this headphone is the best I've ever used even in comparison to the HD 660 S. Gaming in this headphone is only OK and I wouldn't recommend as a competitive gaming headphone.. Although I think they still can be used as a gaming can if need be. Still wish I owned this headphone and will def own one again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Coppock

customer_reviews.title: Great phones, really flat and neutral sounding with very ...
customer_reviews.text: Great phones, really flat and neutral sounding with very good separation in most frequency ranges and a pretty wide soundstage for headphones. Great for hearing small details you couldn't notice otherwise in a mix. The very low and high ends could be a little more vibrant. Also the build quality and packaging feel excellent, but it's hard to give an honest review of the build quality after only a few weeks of use. I would definitely recommend these though, they're better than the vast majority of other headphones I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Dissolved

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones if you do your research.
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely dissatisfied at first with the quality of the sound compared to my Astro A40s that I had been using for several years. This was until one day I decided to plug them directly into the headphone jack on my computer. The sound quality was infinitely better than when it was plugged into the mixamp, which is the exact opposite of what I expected. I don't understand why that is, but once I got a proper dac/amp I was blown away by what I had been missing. If you're getting these headphones, you need to get a dac and amp, otherwise there are other headphones that will sound much better without an amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound how its supposed to be!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are absolutely life changing... They are the best reference open headphones I've ever had the privileged to own. I currently own philips fidelio x1, Beyerdynamics DT990 Pro and now these beautiful cans. I absolutely cant take these off my head. They make my other spectacular headphones sound just average. I cant wait to put these on my head when I get home to enjoy music as it was mixed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Rip-off...It's a piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, do I feel like a sucker...I spent $218 dollars on a set of headphones that isn't worth $25 bucks. I bought them for recording and I have to crank up the master volume to 10, as well as turn the input volume all the way up, just to get a level that I use to get with Bose headphones. with the volume set at 3. What a joke! Absolute 100% garbage and a total rip-off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vision Coatings

customer_reviews.title: Not as great or comfortable as I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: They are generally as comfortable as an $80 pair of crappy headphones. The sound quality is great but the discomfort of the stock ear pads and the head cushions almost spoils this product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Marc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: 1. You need a good headphone amp for these. 2. They are very clean with a slightly recessed midrange and laid back sound signature. 3. They are not as fast/dynamic as earbuds, bigger drivers are always slower. 4. The average person won't probably like them because of their neutral response curve.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad8888

customer_reviews.title: Right side cutout.
customer_reviews.text: When the headset worked the sound reproduction was great, but when the right side would cutout turning the headset from stereo to mono it was not worth the money. The only way to get the right side to engage again was to increase the volume substantially. Just a note. I have two other headphones made by Sennheiser and they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Classics that won't fade away.
customer_reviews.text: After trying the Beyerdynamic T1 and the Sennheiser HD800, I have realized that my desktop equipment could not handle them better than the HD 600 so I turned to the HD600 and loved them. I will be selling my HD 800 and T1 soon. The HD 600 is simply easier to handle for the AMP and DAC and produces a sound that is more musical and non-clinical. I will be keeping this pair.
customer_reviews.author: ¤Kugelblitz¤

customer_reviews.title: Doing Open HPs Right Since 1968
customer_reviews.text: Certainly met my expectations. Very even response across frequencies, with open and uncluterred soundstage. Bass is tight and strong, mids are punchy without being irritating, and highs are clean. Separation is outstanding. These are very accurate, and I have heard detail that I never heard before. Cannot go wrong with these cans at their price point. Highest recommendation. P.S. These are 300 ohm HPs so they require a decent HP preamp. I bought the Schiit Vali 2, is it does the job well at a quite reasonable price. A tube preamp works well with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Beejer

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest sounding headphone at this price
customer_reviews.text: If you look up any review of these headphones they will say that it is a very neutral sounding pair of cans, and they really are. They deliver a very clean reproduction of sound with little if no distortion in the low end when compare to the HD 558s or 598s. My only complaint is that they are very hard to drive and require a decent amp to get any type of volume out of these, but if you ave a good amp that has some mWs letft at 300ohm they by all means get this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M Hart

customer_reviews.title: Cable is thin, expect to replace eventually
customer_reviews.text: Not much to add, everyone already knows these are the headphones. 1 year and 4 months of multiple hours daily use the cable's right ear connector failed; picked up the HD650 replacement cable and I'm back in business. The HD600 cable isn't bad at all actually, just a tad thin; compared to the HD650 cable the connectors are weak.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: These sound beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: In a year and a half with the hd600, I have listened to LP's, CD's, and streaming, using half a dozen different amps and various cables. With these headphones, the source makes a difference, the amp makes a difference, and the cable between the source and the amp makes a difference. The best combinations sound really, really good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: It is hard for me to say anything bad about these headphones
customer_reviews.text: It is hard for me to say anything bad about these headphones. Can you do better? Sure. But the performance of these cans places them in one of the best cost/performance ratios I have ever heard. They do everything exceptionally well... Do not expect them to be bass heavy. As an open backed design they are not intended to compete with the bloated bass designs that seem so prevalent today. They are very natural, smooth, and detailed, without bloat in any portion of the audible spectrum. Image is really nice, and the soundstage is convincing. I've stopped looking for cans. I am thrilled with these.
customer_reviews.author: sandt38

customer_reviews.title: if it can get better than this
customer_reviews.text: Had them for about a year now. All I need to say is, if it can get better than this, I have my doubts it will be that huge of a gap. These headphones have just spoiled me to the point where I'm unsatisfied with any other pair of headphones that I use. Maybe in however many years when I save enough money, I will "upgrade" just to see if I'm missing out on anything. All I know is, I'm completely satisfied with these and plan to use them for as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Worth a look simply on COMFORT alone, but they also sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Great cans. Very balanced. Non-fatiguing sound even at pretty high volume. Extremely comfortable, especially if you place it on something overnight to loosen up the "head pinch" it has right out of box. Make sure you have a good source with enough power to drive these. 300ohms on headphones is no joke. And for god's sake, turn off any bogus 7.1 surround sound settings you may have on your computer if you're using them on it. It will make them sound like garbage (or any other headphones to be honest).
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Giant killers.
customer_reviews.text: Little killers. Do not be fooled that spending more = better performance. These things are giant killers.
customer_reviews.author: TYU

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for recording. Highly accurate sound.
customer_reviews.text: Highly accurate sound, has been a reference headphone for recording for years. Extremely comfortable to wear for hours, open-air design allows you to easily hear what is going on around you.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Staszko

customer_reviews.title: If you are serious about your music, these are for you. Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Hear through design. You are aware of sounds around you when wearing. Phone, doorbell, oven timer easily heard. Superior bass response without loss of other frequencies. If used with a smartphone, an amplifier must be used. The phones don't have enough audio output. Fine for home audio.
customer_reviews.author: Cheeky Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Analytical (Cold, boring) Sound, Wider Soundstage
customer_reviews.text: Wider soundstage than what I am used to. Comparing to $100 razer chroma headphones, these have way less bass and make mid and high notes more clear. If I only had the cheaper headphones, I would never know. The sound is very boring and not worth it. Will be trying out some HE 4xx, and if that doesn't work out I will try the AKG K7xx or the Beyerdynamic DT990
customer_reviews.author: Cody Tam

customer_reviews.title: Superb listening quality
customer_reviews.text: Note that these are open back headphones and do not offer any noise cancellation by design. They offer about the best sound quality you can get at the price point. They are by no means a gaming product, but with the addition of an external mic they will serve that purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Norton

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I’ve heard ever but not very much bass
customer_reviews.text: Great head phones for gaming or music , but the bass is very flat at times, other then that there great. Also very very comfortable on the head. I wear these for 4-5 hours at a time every night and never have sweating ears or pain on the top of my head. But the ear cup sometimes does rub the top of my ear and It’s a bit annoying when you first put them on. But your forget about it in a few minutes
customer_reviews.author: K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Complex and demanding Cans...
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a while now, and was uninmpressed mostly because i didnt had a decent amp to use with them. I recently picked up a xDuoo TA-01 and what a difference does it make! Dont judge theses without a competent Amp. They do make up for the high energy consumption with a clear neutral sound. After a few months using them i have to say they bring out so many sound levels i never even knew were there for most of the albums i usually listen to. Worthy intial step into the audiophile world
customer_reviews.author: Jaxel Rojas Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound but I have slight preference for Hifiman HE-400i. Headphones are ear of the beholder though - what one person likes another dislikes. See reviews before buying - these are classic headphones. They are very well constructed and look like they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Meticulous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent neutral headphones with fantastic audio quality!
customer_reviews.text: As a composer and sound mixer, I needed something neutral that would not require a lot of EQing on the computer’s sound output in order to listen to something accurately. These headphones do the trick perfectly. These are open back headphones, meaning if you play something too loud, everyone around can hear it. Additionally, you will be able to hear the environment around you, although it sounds muffled. I have never been able to properly hear the bass in sound and music with my old headphones, but as soon as I put these on I could hear it all. I will definitely buy from Sennheiser in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Menear

customer_reviews.title: A+ would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best headphones in it's tier. Past this point would be the point of diminishing returns, these headphones will make great use out of a high end setup. Against common belief, these headphones will make everything sound better, including not so high fidelity sound sources. These bring life out of the music, has an an expansive soundstage and are fairly neutral and accurate. It does not get much better than this unless you are willing to pay much more. I'm running these through a Schiit Magni Amp+Modi DAC, excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Woodsmith

customer_reviews.title: price and quality had a glorious audio child
customer_reviews.text: i've been a sennheiser fan since my first pair of 555s about 8 years ago. i then upgraded to a set of the 595s. i watched some reviews which said the 600s walk the perfect line between quality and price and i completely agree. if you have an amp that can push these bad boys to their potential, they are totally worth it. i have them paired with a sound blaster x7 and couldn't be happier. the only downside in my opinion is the wires on both sides. i prefer the one larger wire on one side.
customer_reviews.author: TeeGeeOh

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly natural sound, great for mixing!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding headphones I have ever owned. I guess that's not saying much since these are also the most expensive headphones I've ever owned. BUT, if for checking mixes, they've been invaluable. I cannot stress how natural these open-backed headphones sound. In fact I forget I'm wearing them, I just marvel at how clean my room sounds and then remember it's because I'm wearing these headphones. I mix for hours on these without fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: CWCadwell

customer_reviews.title: a way to sound smoother
customer_reviews.text: This headphone sounds as good as people say. However it could sound very different for different people because of their ears causing variations in ear resonance. This means it will have peaks or severe dips around 3khz onwards. I found a way to smooth out the response by rotating it backwards (so the headband wraps behind your neck) and putting your ears in the center. also pull out the headband about 8 clicks. This makes it sound smoother and more detailed for me, but experiment your own positions to find what's best for you.
customer_reviews.author: davidtriune

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, just not my sound.
customer_reviews.text: Bass Not over emphasized, mids and highs are very bright. Like some reviews say, mids and highs are clinical sounding. I can’t say these sound bad, I just like a little more mellowness to my headphones if that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: dersom

customer_reviews.title: Neutral sounding beauty !
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these. They are neutral sounding nothing over emphasized. They fit snugged at first after wearing for a little bit they conform to head size. The color is different and to me they look very pretty. I am using with JDS Atom headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: My first set of high quality headphones were DT770s and ...
customer_reviews.text: My first set of high quality headphones were DT770s and boy can you hear the higher quality in the HD 600s. To be fair the HD 600s are roughly ~$200 more expensive and it is a comparison between open and closed headphones. The HD 600s are worth every penny and I haven't even acquired my Schiit stack yet. Cons: The headphones may cause some users to experience a slight pinching pain at the top of their heads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to take the leap to audiophile level headphones without breaking the bank and researched online and found that these were these were highly recommended. I was not disappointed. I bough this headphone with the schiit magni2/modi and the combo sounds fantastic. I can listen for hours and not get fatigued. The headphones are very comfortable and the sound is pleasant and neutral. I'm very happy with these headphones and would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: lamchops_sf

customer_reviews.title: Simply Superb
customer_reviews.text: What great headphones for the money! Even minus an amp, the definition is fantastic. I listen to all kinds of music, and am picky about sound quality. With classical, this headset really shines. Mahler's 2nd will take you to the heights. Bach will make you weep.
customer_reviews.author: PKL

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile worthy
customer_reviews.text: There are headphones that run in the thousands... but these do very well at a low price: They have a well rounded bass, real staging of music, and clean well distributed range. Love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: John Hermanson

customer_reviews.title: Best Audiophile headphones. But
customer_reviews.text: Best Audiophile headphones. Period. - But below are some problems Sennheiser needs to rake care. 1. Authentication sticker inside the grill is missing. It was there before. This is important for many. 2. Quality is not same as before.
customer_reviews.author: Latnit1

customer_reviews.title: The standard in neutral sound for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable with a nice large soundstage, much more restrained than my Grado's, but you can listen for hours without fatigue. The 600's are the standard in neutral sound for those dipping there toes into audiophile-level cans. Be sure to get a nice DAC/AMP to power these and some high quality audio files and you won't be disappointed. Another advantage over my Grado's, if anything breaks (they feel extremely solid) you can essentially rebuild these by ordering parts through Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: andrew p

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding buckets
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, and very comfortable once they break in a bit. Just remember that you need to plug these into a good audio source to get the 110% of their potential, but they still sound amazing on a mobile device.
customer_reviews.author: Nebulon5000

customer_reviews.title: Detailed headphone
customer_reviews.text: These have the best mid-range/vocals I've ever heard from any headphone. The treble is controlled, not harsh, not punchy. The bass is there, not heavy and is also controlled. These are detail oriented headphones, made for music referencing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have always used headphones that were on a cheaper side because for me headphones were headphones, but boy was i wrong. I finally researched and bought these and oh my god..Everything sounds so clear! I can hear every instrument and it basically murdered every headphones i ever used. As for comfort, it is very comfortable and light! There's times where i would forget i have it on and accidentally pull it when getting up. Also, having an open back, not only does it help make it sound amazing, it helps me hear what my dog is up to behind my back thinking that i'm not listening. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Industry Standard
customer_reviews.text: There's higher end headphones out there, but this offers a sound that always neutral and enjoyable. Obviously provides no noise cancellation, and leaks sound; but that's the nature of this style and sound of headphone.
customer_reviews.author: coolfool182

customer_reviews.title: ... them to my Sony STR-D1011S receiver and they sound great, even without a separate amp
customer_reviews.text: Received my HD 600 today and connected them to my Sony STR-D1011S receiver and they sound great, even without a separate amp! I was really concerned they would require an additional amp and was happy they sound fine. I suspect I can get a better sound with a separate amp and will follow up later as soon as I can find one that I can easily be hook up. Really a great headphone and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Scofield

customer_reviews.title: Still good.
customer_reviews.text: I mixed my whole album on these and it came out amazing. And it is for sale here on Amazon! They are super comfortable. They are not bass heavy, but hey these cans are for mixing. You want a balanced response. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: G G

customer_reviews.title: So good, I got a second pair!
customer_reviews.text: Let me say, I just love the marble finish on these. The design is fantastic, though some have pointed out it could be made of hardier material. Very true, but they're definitely sturdy enough for home use. Sound is brilliant and balanced. Bass is plentiful, though maybe not as deep as DT880/600. I feel like the DT880 sounds more distant though, or perhaps it's a volume discrepancy (switching between headphones of different efficiencies will do that). I upgraded to the HD650 cable which is beefier and more reliable. My second pair I bought for $120 with a Bithead amp, there was no way I could pass that up. No complaints at all about the HD600, only the weak stock cable.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Music
customer_reviews.text: Delightful! I chanced upon Brooko's Reviews at head-fi.org. He wrote a very thorough article on his comparison of the Sennheiser HD600 and HD650. This was very helpful. I spent more on these headphones than planned, but I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: neo incognito

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones. Most expensive and best pair I've ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones. Most expensive and best pair I've ever owned. Upgraded from my tried and true HD 595s, which are still going strong after many years—a testament to Sennheiser's quality for these kinds of headphones. Definitely worth the upgrade if you have the money to spare as the difference in overall quality is profound. And that's saying something, because the HD 595s are excellent cans as well. If this pair lasts anywhere near as long as my HD 595s, Sennheiser will probably be getting more of my money down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Mkoll

customer_reviews.title: AKG K712 pro VS HD600
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the AKG K712pro, the HD600: +have a more balanced sound +are a pleasure to listen to, no ear fatigue +are ok without amp +are made in Ireland -are not the most comfortable to wear for the price, pretty tight and oh god how I miss the plush ear pads from the AKG :( -can't beat the soundstage from the AKG K712pro -don't look as good? -don't beat the AKG K712pro's bass Verdict: I decided to sell my AKG K712pro to buy these after a try, I realised they had the balanced sound I was looking for which is the most important. I could spend hours listening to music and mixing on them but ouch, it's tight!
customer_reviews.author: Encore French Lessons

customer_reviews.title: but the headphones are super awesome. I have a few pair of really ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of improvements could be made to the cable, but the headphones are super awesome. I have a few pair of really nice headphones (multi-hundred dollar) and these are one of my favorite pairs. Bass is a little lacking, but thats a tradeoff with open backed headphones...definitely makes up for it with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: right side failed after a year
customer_reviews.text: so these sound decent. i paid 300 and i expect 300 dollars worth of value. the right side gave out after a year. ordering a new cable to see if its the issue and will change the rating according to results. i listen to hiphop, lofi, and some rock and honestly i think you need a DAC to really open up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Audio Nirvana
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing. I highly recommend getting some sort of headphone amp/dac so you can get the most from these fabulous cans. I heard a pair plugged into an Eddie Current Balancing Act tube amp and could not believe my ears. You can always upgrade your amp, but might not ever want to upgrade these headphones. Although, the much more expensive HD800s do sound amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best set of 'phones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of Sennheiser 590 headphones for years, until an internal wire let go and killed one channel. I saw so many positive reviews of theses headphones and got such a sweet deal on Amazon that I just had to try them. They are comfortable in the extreme. And the sound is rich and very satisfying for hours on end. For the first time, I find that I am satisfied to listen to headphones instead of my speakers. They are open backed, so when my wife is clunking around in the kitchen I have to switch to my closed backed Beyerdynamics. Otherwise, these get the nod.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Oltman

customer_reviews.title: So this is how hi-res sounds like
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the rave reviews I've been reading about, and boy was I happy to finally be able to listen to it personally. I was blown away by the detail of sound it's able to produce. I'm also glad it pairs well with my Schiit stack. The only thing I didn't like is the cable; it's so damn long. But overall, I'm really glad I got it. It far exceeded my expectations, sound-wise. I would highly recommend it to someone who's looking for a decent set of cans on a budget. This is the best open-back headphones out there in this price range, so go grab one. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews of these headphones, I was expecting a lot, and they meet my expectations in every way! These are beautiful headphones, in looks and sound. I have no amp/DAC right now, and they are still clear and natural sounding and super comfortable. Even though they are 300 ohm headphones, I have no problems with volume without an amplifier plugged into my phone, tablet, or laptop. Sub bass does roll off. Will update when I get a DAC.
customer_reviews.author: stiff

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal!!
customer_reviews.text: After buying 2 other pair which I thought were very good..these are in a totally different class..I never knew my stereo could sound so sweet....LOVE THEM!!! Oh the OTHER pair were different cheaper brands..but still good for the price..
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: I've kept reading and checking the performance of the HD600's often and I'm still happy with my choice
customer_reviews.text: I've never listened to the HD650's (no retail store nor owner nearby) but I have read about them and these also from many sources and I concluded that the HD600's were so close sounding to the HD650's that it wasn't worth the extra $$$ to to buy them. I've kept reading and checking the performance of the HD600's often and I'm still happy with my choice. I've seen both sold on Amazon for less multiple times. Check the price history and grab one or the other or both on sale. It should make you happy.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Peterson

customer_reviews.title: These headphones when paired with a good amp are transcendent
customer_reviews.text: These headphones when paired with a good amp are transcendent. I plug mine into my Sound Blaster X AE-5. It drives up to 600 ohms. Honestly these are helping me rediscover all of my music is detailed and nuanced glory.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Great allrounders. Scale well
customer_reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with these cans. Great allrounders. Scale well, especially with tubes, but not overly picky or hard to please, like big brother HD800's.
customer_reviews.author: F. Pantalone

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously good value
customer_reviews.text: I've used DT-990s for 3-5 years before trying these out, and GEEZ these are incredible. It's so incredibly clear and crisp without being overbearing on any spectrum. I use these in combination with the Schitt Modi/Magni 2 and would wholeheartedly recommend for any user.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long and is there a rating higher than 5!
customer_reviews.text: You can find thousands of reviews on the HD600, stop reading them and go buy a pair!
customer_reviews.author: cnnlive10

customer_reviews.title: The required audiophile headphone.
customer_reviews.text: The HD600 has been an audiophile favorite for two decades for good reason. Its sound is open and airy, well-balanced across the frequency range, and just a pleasure to listen with. It does everything well. The downsides: It really isn't well-suited for portable use, with its long cable, low sensitivity, and open design. It doesn't have the strongest low bass, but it's certainly adequate.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gurdal

customer_reviews.title: Very good! Netural.
customer_reviews.text: I am a mastering engineer & although i master mainly on top transmission line speakers, when the music is mastered correctly, These cans will let u know! I feel they are more neutral then the hd 650. If they were all u had to work with. These woud do well!😎
customer_reviews.author: G. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great balance straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Have several high end phones used to check my mixes. Senn HD800 and Mr Speakers Ether both costing several times the price of the HD600. This headphone while not in the same league still manages to keep up with these flagship phones. Great balance straight out of the box. Using with a Little Labs Monotor amp and Dangeous Monitor ST. Hoping Sennheiser does not discontinue.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cham

customer_reviews.title: Delivery was super quick, product packaged very well
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was super quick, product packaged very well. The headphones? Only proper other set of headphones I own and can compare too is the Sennheiser HD 540 Ref II - the HD 600 is every bit as clear and high def, but with added oomph in the lower ranges. Sound Blaster Z as source, am really loving the sound, turned off the crystalizer and bass sound enhancement as well as the equalizer as it is not required with the HD 600. Excellent headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Brand

customer_reviews.title: Like a pair of studio monitors on your head
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a means to continue producing music after my roommates call it a night. Pleased to say they are fantastic for listening to every detail as well as listing to music for pleasure. Paired with a Micca Orgin G2 for every day use and a schiit magni 3 hooked up to my Motu Traveler they're layers in the music that I can pick out cleanly in the same way I can on my trusty studio monitors. Pulled the trigger when they droped below 300 USD and are well worth the cost but be sure you have clean source that can drive them as they recommend pushing power past 300 ohms.
customer_reviews.author: ATSinclair

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, but needs a good headphone amp to drive them.
customer_reviews.text: Please do these justice by driving them with a proper amp. When properly driven they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.text: I have owned mine around 10 years and got these for a friend. They are superb. Clear, accurate, comfortable and don't cause listening fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening to music
customer_reviews.text: KILLER cans. Great for listening to music, mixing music, jamming with guitar amp modelers... Best bang-for-the-buck headphones you can buy. Note that they're open-backed, so you'll hear ambient noise and others can hear what you're listening to, so they're not for public listening or critical vocal recording. For everything else, however, they rule.
customer_reviews.author: The Audacity Works

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound but meh
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound but meh, it's a little boring. More modern stuff by hifiman and even Sennheiser, is worth the shot. Specially the 400s and the HD 700. Both are amazingly good, but I still prefer the hifiman cause the Sennheiser tend to be a little too bright that it hurts my ears
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful headphone...
customer_reviews.text: This is the hall of fame headphone...I love the sound(connect with wooaudio wa6. It is beautiful amp). Very detail...clear...not over bass but musical..I highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Seung Cha

customer_reviews.title: very revealing Excellent transparency and separation Very detailed and articulate Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Crispy and forward mids Neutral and flat, very revealing Excellent transparency and separation Very detailed and articulate Cons: Build does not feel premium Double wire setup may get in the way Overall these are great headphones for those who are already getting into this hobby. They've existed for a long time and still hold up to their game as one of the best in their price range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best
customer_reviews.text: I have hearing problems due to too many IEDs and firing in the military. I ordered these while I was deployed and they have been so great. The range of sound and richness of sound is crazy. I upgraded from my Beats headphones to these. The difference was jaw-dropping. You do, obviously, need a system or device that can push the Ohm rating to actually use them. Anything 1000 watts or more should be fine. Bear in mind, these are high-end headphones and aren't meant for your cheap devices or low-end stereo systems. They won't sound very good on those.
customer_reviews.author: Bacon Overlord

customer_reviews.title: Smooth! Works great with my digital Piano.
customer_reviews.text: I returned HS660's since they were too strident in the mids and upper range. Grating is a good description. I got the HD600's and they are smooth! Sound great with my digital piano.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 600 Open Back Professional Headphone
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Sennheiser HD 600 

The HD 600 is an audiophile-grade open dynamic hi-fi/professional stereo headphone. The advanced diaphragm design eliminates standing waves resulting in a clean sound free of artifacts and acoustical disturbances. The HD 600 is a fantastic addition to a hi-fi stack or dedicated listening room, and is a favorite among mastering engineers worldwide. 

 * Natural, spatial imaging 
 * Exceptional transient response 
 * Optimized for hi-resolution recordings 
 * Made in Ireland 

Learn more about the HD 600 "I have used my HD 600's for casual and critical listening ever since I got my pair. I can depend on the HD 600 in many different environments and can always expect great results out of it." -Kazuri Arai, Recording/Mix Engineer



Features  * High-quality open metal mesh grilles deliver extremely transparent sound 
 * Computer optimized magnet systems minimize harmonic and intermodulation distortion 
 * Extremely lightweight aluminum voice coils ensure excellent transient response 
 * Neodymium ferrous magnet systems ensure optimum sensitivity and an excellent dynamic response 
 * Exceptionally natural, spatial and accurate sound 
 * Detachable, Kevlar reinforced, OFC copper cable 
 * Peace of mind - thanks to the 2-year international warranty

Did you know? The HD 600 is a true audiophile headphone designed for one of the best listening experiences. Optimized for minimum distortion, the HD 600 features Open-Aire speakers for a natural listening experience.

Sennheiser recommends this headset for... ... The HD 600 is geared for your hi-fi stereo system. Best suited for all types of audio the HD 600 is a favorite among mastering engineers worldwide.

What they're saying... "I have used my HD 600's for casual and critical listening ever since I got my pair. I can depend on the HD 600 in many different environments and can always expect great results out of it." -Kazuri Arai, Recording/Mix Engineer

Warranty The HD 600 is covered by a 2-year international warranty.

Comparison table HD 600 HD 650 Frequency response 12 - 39000 Hz 10 - 39500 Hz Impedance 300 ohms 300 ohms Transducer principle Dynamic, open Dynamic, open Sound pressure level (SPL) 97 103 dB THD, total harmonic distortion 0.1 % 0.05 % Weight w/o cable 0.57lb (260 g) 0.57lb (260 g) Contact pressure ca. 2,5 N ca. 2,5 N Ear coupling Circumaural Circumaural Jack plug 1/4" / 1/8" (3.5/6.3 mm) stereo 1/4" / 1/8" (3.5/6.3 mm) stereo Warranty 2 Years 2 Years Why Sennheiser ? For over 60 years every Sennheiser mic or headphone comes with a built-in mission: to stay true to the sound and soul the music was given by its artist. From the fragile intimacy of a whispered word to the deep and dark punch of an attacking bassline. Sennheiser delivers pure emotion and excitement. A quality that has convinced a broad spectrum of artists and of course music lovers all over the world. Sennheiser offers a great experience for everyone who really wants to hear. 

What's in the box?  * HD 600 
 * 1 adaptor to 1/4" (6.3 mm)
feature_bullets: Lightweight aluminum voice coils ensure excellent transient response
Neodymium ferrous magnets maintain optimum sensitivity and excellent dynamics
Sophisticated design, elegantly finished in black and gray
High quality open metal mesh earpiece covers
Detachable, Kevlar reinforced oxygen free copper cable with very low handling noise
Note: The unit ships with 1 ¼” (6.3 mm) headphone adapter plug

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,141 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
